byline.contributor: Lisa W. Foderaro reported from Goshen, and Rick Rojas from New York.
byline.original: By LISA W. FODERARO and RICK ROJAS

abstract: Orange County, NY, prosecutors charge Angelika Graswald with second-degree murder as well as second-degree manslaughter in death of fiance Vincent Viafore, whose body was found in Hudson River near where couple had been kayaking weeks before; call for witnesses who may know more about alleged crime to come forward; defense maintains Graswald's innocence and says death was accident due to victim's own carelessness.
lead_paragraph: In a news conference on Tuesday, prosecutors disclosed new details in the death of Vincent Viafore, the kayaker who had been missing for weeks.

headline.main: Kayak Suspect Moved Paddle Away as Fiancé Died, Prosecutors Say
headline.print_headline: Prosecutors Allege Fiancée Thwarted Kayaker’s Rescue

snippet: In a news conference on Tuesday, prosecutors disclosed new details in the death of Vincent Viafore, the kayaker who had been missing for weeks.
